intro: Porterandia cladantha, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. Porterandia cladantha thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
